intro: Hypocalymma dimorphandrum, commonly known as the two-form flame bush, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, flame-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually red or orange, and they appear in clusters at the ends of branches. Hypocalymma dimorphandrum is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
